Belgium: David Teniers the Younger, The Oude Voetboog Guild in the Grote Markt )painting)
Bhutan: A joint Mongol-Tibetan force sought to destroy Nyingma refugees who had fled to Bhutan, Sikkim, and Nepal. The Mongols had seized control of religious and civil power in Tibet in the 1630s and established the Gelug school as the state religion. Bhutanese rivals of Ngawang Namgyal encouraged the Mongol intrusion, but the Mongol force was easily defeated in the humid lowlands of southern Bhutan.
Chile:
A Dutch expedition led by plunders Carelmapu and Castro soon after. Governor of Chiloé Andrés Herrera dies in battle and is replaced by Fernando de Alvarado.
The Dutch, now led by Elias Herckmans, establish a base at the ruins of Valdivia.
The Dutch retreat from Valdivia to Constantino Island and then to Dutch Brazil.
China:
Hong Taiji died.
Hong Taiji's young son the Shunzhi Emperor became emperor of the Qing dynasty.
France: Louis died.  His five-year-old son Louis XIV succeeded him. Cardinal Mazarin became regent.
Philippine: Universidad de San Felipe de Austria closed down
Tonga: Abel Tasman visited Tongatapu and Haʻapai.
